info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 7:50AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wabash, Noble, northern Grant, Whitley, Huntington, southeastern Kosciusko, Lagrange, Steuben, western Allen, De Kalb, central Wells, southeastern Miami, St. Joseph and western Branch Counties through 830 AM EDT... At 750 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Schoolcraft to near Ligonier to near Columbia City to 6 miles east of Mexico. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Ligonier and Topeka around 755 AM EDT. Rome City around 800 AM EDT. Lagrange and Churubusco around 805 AM EDT. North Manchester and Huntertown around 810 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Avilla, South Whitley, Angola, Garrett, Auburn, Waterloo and Hamilton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 469 between mile markers 0 and 11, and between mile markers 27 and 30. Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 270 and 357. Interstate 69 in Michigan between mile markers 1 and 4. Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 110 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
